perturbation.original_text: 2. Period of transportation services: this Agreement is valid for an indefinite term. Subsequent contracts might be entered in case of special business.
perturbation.changed_text: 2. Period of transportation services: this Agreement is valid for an indefinite term. This agreement shall automatically terminate 30 days after the shipper provides written notice to the carrier. Subsequent contracts might be entered in case of special business.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the agreement is valid for an indefinite term, creating certainty. The modified text contradicts this by stating that the agreement can be terminated with 30 days notice, introducing uncertainty and a conflicting term length.

perturbation.original_text: 3. Freight and payment method: (a) Verification of freight: Party A pays freight based on carload rate (such freight includes pick-up charges, door-to-door delivery charges and tax fees). (b) Party A shall not pay any other charges other than the freight.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. Freight and payment method: (a) Verification of freight: Party A pays freight based on carload rate (such freight includes pick-up charges, door-to-door delivery charges and tax fees). (b) Party A shall reimburse Party B for all reasonable expenses incurred during transportation, in addition to the freight.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that Party A shall not pay any other charges other than the freight. The modified text directly contradicts this by saying Party A will reimburse Party B for all reasonable expenses incurred during transportation, creating conflicting payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: 15. Any different interpretation of this Agreement by both Parties is subject to final interpretation by Party A.
perturbation.changed_text: 15. Any different interpretation of this Agreement by both Parties is subject to mutual agreement and negotiation. Should mutual agreement not be reached, the dispute resolution mechanism outlined in Section 12 shall apply.
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives Party A the final say on any interpretation of the agreement. The modified text contradicts this by mandating mutual agreement, and resorting to the section on dispute resolution should there be no agreement, creating uncertainty in who has final interpretive authority. It introduces an element of negotiation that did not exist before.
